briefdescription.para: Determine wether the given character is valid as the first character in a name.
Determine wether the given character is valid as a second or later character in a name.
Determine wether the given character is valid as the first character in a bus name.
Determine wether the given character is valid as a second or later character in a bus name.
Verifies that the range of type_str from type_pos to type_end is a valid signature.

detaileddescription.para: If this function returns TRUE, it will be safe to iterate over the signature with a types-only DBusTypeReader. The range passed in should NOT include the terminating nul/DBUS_TYPE_INVALID.

simplesect.para: DBUS_VALID if valid, reason why invalid otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusTypeReader *reader, int byte_order, dbus_bool_t walk_reader_to_end, int total_depth, const unsigned char *p, const unsigned char *end, const unsigned char **new_p)
memberdef.name: validate_body_helper

memberdef.argsstring: (const DBusString *expected_signature, int expected_signature_start, int byte_order, int *bytes_remaining, const DBusString *value_str, int value_pos, int len)
memberdef.name: _dbus_validate_body_with_reason

briefdescription.para: Verifies that the range of value_str from value_pos to value_end is a legitimate value of type expected_signature.

detaileddescription.para: If this function returns TRUE, it will be safe to iterate over the values with DBusTypeReader. The signature is assumed to be already valid.
If bytes_remaining is not NULL, then leftover bytes will be stored there and DBUS_VALID returned. If it is NULL, then DBUS_INVALID_TOO_MUCH_DATA will be returned if bytes are left over.

parameterdescription.para: the expected types in the value_str
where in expected_signature is the signature

simplesect.para: DBUS_VALID if valid, reason why invalid otherwise

briefdescription.para: Checks that the given range of the string is a valid object path name in the D-Bus protocol.

detaileddescription.para: Part of the validation ensures that the object path contains only ASCII.

xrefdescription.para: this is inconsistent with most of DBusString in that it allows a start,len range that extends past the string end.
change spec to disallow more things, such as spaces in the path name

simplesect.para: TRUE if the byte range exists and is a valid name

briefdescription.para: Checks that the given range of the string is a valid interface name in the D-Bus protocol.

detaileddescription.para: This includes a length restriction and an ASCII subset, see the specification.

xrefdescription.para: this is inconsistent with most of DBusString in that it allows a start,len range that extends past the string end.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the byte range exists and is a valid name

briefdescription.para: Checks that the given range of the string is a valid member name in the D-Bus protocol.

detaileddescription.para: This includes a length restriction, etc., see the specification.

xrefdescription.para: this is inconsistent with most of DBusString in that it allows a start,len range that extends past the string end.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the byte range exists and is a valid name

briefdescription.para: Checks that the given range of the string is a valid error name in the D-Bus protocol.

detaileddescription.para: This includes a length restriction, etc., see the specification.

xrefdescription.para: this is inconsistent with most of DBusString in that it allows a start,len range that extends past the string end.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the byte range exists and is a valid name

memberdef.argsstring: (const DBusString *str, int start, int len, dbus_bool_t is_namespace)
memberdef.name: _dbus_validate_bus_name_full

briefdescription.para: Checks that the given range of the string is a valid bus name in the D-Bus protocol.

detaileddescription.para: This includes a length restriction, etc., see the specification.

xrefdescription.para: this is inconsistent with most of DBusString in that it allows a start,len range that extends past the string end.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the byte range exists and is a valid name

briefdescription.para: Checks that the given range of the string is a prefix of a valid bus name in the D-Bus protocol.

detaileddescription.para: Unlike _dbus_validate_bus_name(), this accepts strings with only one period-separated component.

xrefdescription.para: this is inconsistent with most of DBusString in that it allows a start,len range that extends past the string end.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the byte range exists and is a valid name

briefdescription.para: Checks that the given range of the string is a valid message type signature in the D-Bus protocol.

xrefdescription.para: this is inconsistent with most of DBusString in that it allows a start,len range that extends past the string end.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the byte range exists and is a valid signature
